body_html:
@IvanZhangDoIt
Hi, Ivan

I have solved my problem, you can try the following:

  1. Kill all the running process, to make sure GPU have suffice memory. use command "nvidia-smi" see the running process, and use command "kill -9 id" to kill it.
  2. Make sure your network not very large, Check if there is an oversized fully connected layer.
  3. Checking if float64 is used will double your memory.
  4. Check if the adam/RMSprop optimization algorithm is used. These optimization algorithms will record historical gradients and will double the memory usage.

Yaohua Guo
